data.quote: There are no secrets to success. It is the result of preparation  hard work  learning from failure.
data.author: General Colin L. Powell

data.quote: Success is blocked by concentrating on it and planning for it.... Success is shy-it won't come out while you're watching.
data.author: Tennessee Williams

data.quote: Three outstanding qualities make for success: judgement  industry  health. And the greatest of these is judgement.
data.author: William Maxwell Aitken

data.quote: Thirteen virtues necessary for true success: temperance  silence  order  resolution  frugality  industry  sincerity  justice  moderation  cleanliness  tranquility  chastity  and humility.
data.author: Benjamin Franklin

data.quote: Find a need and fill it.
data.author: Ruth Stafford Peale

data.quote: Put your heart  mind  intellect and soul even to your smallest acts. This is the secret of success.
data.author: Swami Sivananda

data.quote: Four steps to achievement: plan purposefully  prepare prayerfully  proceed positively  pursue persistently.
data.author: William A. Ward

data.quote: Success follows doing what you want to do. There is no other way to be successful.
data.author: Malcolm Forbes

data.quote: Always aim for achievement  and forget about success.

data.quote: Success  which is something so simple in the end  is made up of thousands of things  we never fully know what.

data.quote: Self-trust is the first secret of success.

data.quote: The man who will use his skill and constructive imagination to see how much he can give for a dollar  instead of how little he can give for a dollar  is bound to succeed.

data.author: Catharine Marshall

data.quote: The art of dealing with people is the foremost secret of successful men. A man's success in handling people is the very yardstick by which the outcome of his whole life's work is measured.

data.quote: The ability to form friendships  to make people believe in you and trust you is one of the few absolutely fundamental qualities of success. Selling  buying  negotiating are so much smoother and easier when the parties enjoy each other's confidence. The young man who can make friends quickly will find that he will glide  instead of stumble  through life.
data.author: John J. McGuirk

data.quote: Networking is an enrichment program  not an entitlement program.
data.author: Susan RoAne

data.quote: Respect for people is the cornerstone of communication and networking.

data.quote: No matter how much a man can do  no matter how engaging his personality may be  he will not advance far in business if he cannot work through others.

data.quote: The way to rise is to obey and please.
data.author: Ben Johnson

data.quote: Skill is fine  and genius is splendid  but the right contacts are more valuable than either.

data.quote: Whatever your grade or position  if you know how and when to speak  and when to remain silent  your chances of real success are proportionately increased.
data.author: Ralph C. Smedley

data.quote: That they can strengthen through the empowerment of others is essential wisdom often gathered by women.
data.author: Mary Field Belenky

data.quote: A man can succeed at almost anything for which he has unlimited enthusiasm.

data.quote: You have to block everything out and be extremely focused and be relaxed and mellow too.

data.quote: I've never sought success in order to get fame and money  it's the talent and the passion that count in success.

data.quote: Flaming enthusiasm  backed up by horse sense and persistence  is the quality that most frequently makes for success.
data.author: Dale Carnegie

data.quote: Anyone who has gumption knows what it is  and anyone who hasn't can never know what it is.
data.author: L. M. Montgomery

data.quote: The world belongs to the energetic.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: I feel that one must deliberate then act  must scan every life choice with rational thinking but then base the decision on whether one's heart will be in it.

data.quote: Since everything is in our heads  we better not lose them.

data.quote: There is a passion for perfection which you rarely see fully developed  but you may note this fact  that in successful lives it is never wholly lacking.

data.quote: Many of the most successful men I have known have never grown up. They have retained bubbling-over boyishness. They have relished wit  they have indulged in humor. They have not allowed "dignity" to depress them into moroseness. Youthfulness of spirit is the twin brother of optimism  and optimism is the stuff of which American business success is fashioned. Resist growing up!
data.author: B. C. Forbes

data.quote: People are subject to moods  to temptations and fears  lethargy and aberration and ignorance  and the staunchest qualities shift under the stresses and strains of daily life.
data.author: Ilka Chase

data.quote: Whoever said  "It's not whether you win or lose that counts " probably lost.

data.quote: If you have the will to win  you have achieved half your success  if you don't  you have achieved half your failure.

data.quote: Someone's always saying  "It's not whether you win or lose " but if you feel that way  you're as good as dead.
data.author: James Caan

data.quote: The real difference between men is energy.
data.author: Thomas Fuller

data.quote: Success is going from failure to failure without loss of enthusiasm.

data.quote: To bring one's self to a frame of mind and to the proper energy to accomplish things that require plain hard work continuously is the one big battle that everyone has. When this battle is won for all time  then everything is easy.

data.quote: We would accomplish many more things if we did not think of them as impossible.

data.quote: Faith that the thing can be done is essential to any great achievement.

data.quote: Sometimes success is due less to ability than to zeal.

data.quote: Optimism is essential to achievement and it is also the foundation of courage and of true progress.

data.quote: Morale is the greatest single factor in successful wars.

data.quote: The will to conquer is the first condition of victory.

data.quote: Always bear in mind that your own resolution to success is more important than any other one thing.
data.author: Abraham Lincoln

data.quote: The real secret of success is enthusiasm. Yes  more than enthusiasm  I would say excitement. I like to see men get excited. When they get excited  they make a success of their lives.

data.quote: The measure of an enthusiasm must be taken between interesting events. It is between bites that the lukewarm angler loses heart.

data.quote: Enthusiasm for one's goal lessens the disagreeableness of working toward it.

data.quote: To burn always with this hard gemlike flame  to maintain this ecstasy  is success in life.

data.quote: Every man is enthusiastic at times. One man has enthusiasm for thirty minutes  another man has it for thirty days. But it is the man who has it for thirty years who makes a success in life.

data.quote: Man never rises to great truths without enthusiasm.

data.quote: Success is due less to ability than to zeal.

data.quote: I rate enthusiasm even above professional skill.

data.quote: Nothing great was ever achieved without enthusiasm.

data.quote: What a man accomplishes in a day depends upon the way in which he approaches his tasks. When we accept tough jobs as a challenge to our ability and wade into them with joy and enthusiasm  miracles can happen. When we do our work with a dynamic conquering spirit  we get things done.

data.quote: If you're not happy every morning when you get up  leave for work  or start to work at home  if you're not enthusiastic about doing that  you're not going to be successful.

data.quote: A wise man will make more opportunities than he finds.

data.quote: No man will succeed unless he is ready to face and overcome difficulties and prepared to assume responsibilities.
data.author: William J. H. Boetcker

data.quote: Man is still responsible. ... His success lies not with the stars  but with himself. He must carry on the fight of self-correction and discipline.

data.quote: The brave man carves out his fortune  and every man is the sum of his own works.
data.author: Miguel de Cervantes

data.quote: If a man wants his dreams to come true  he must wake up.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Men at some time are masters of their fates.

data.quote: The great majority of successful business men and women have been and are possessors of strong personalities of the right sort  and by analyzing their climb to success it is amazing to discover how large a part good manners  good breeding  and correct behavior have had in helping them to win the goal.

data.quote: I don't eat junk food and I don't think junk thoughts.

data.quote: Four steps to achievement: plan purposefully  prepare prayerfully  proceed positively  pursue persistently.

data.quote: I'm hardnosed about luck. I think it sucks. Yeah  if you spend seven years looking for a job as a copywriter  and then one day somebody gives you a job  you can say  "Gee  I was lucky I happened to go up there today." But dammit  I was going to go up there sooner or later in the next seventy years. ... If you're persistent in trying and doing and working  you almost make your own fortune.

data.quote: Flaming enthusiasm  backed up by horse sense and persistence  is the quality that most frequently makes for success.

data.quote: It's the plugging away that will win you the day So don't be a piker  old pard! Just draw on your grit  it's so easy to quit- It's the keeping your chin up that's hard.

data.quote: Be of good cheer. Do not think of today's failures  but of the success that may come tomorrow. You have set yourselves a difficult task  but you will succeed if you persevere  and you will find a joy in overcoming obstacles. Remember  no effort that we make to attain something beautiful is ever lost.
data.author: Helen Keller

data.quote: The way to succeed is never quit. That's it. But really be humble about it. ... You start out lowly and humble and you carefully try to learn an accretion of little things that help you get there.
data.author: Alex Haley

data.quote: Continuous effort-not strength or intelligence-is the key to unlocking our potential.
data.author: Winston Churchill

data.quote: Plodding wins the race.
data.author: Aesop

data.quote: The difficulties and struggles of today are but the price we must pay for the accomplishments and victories of tomorrow.
data.author: William J. H. Boetcker

data.quote: Let me tell you the secret that has led me to my goal. My strength lies solely in my tenacity.
data.author: Louis Pasteur

data.quote: A winner never quits  and a quitter never wins.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: It isn't hard to be good from time to time in sports. What's tough is being good every day.
data.author: Willie Mays

data.quote: If you start to take Vienna  take Vienna.
data.author: Napoleon Bonaparte

data.quote: There's such a thin line between winning and losing.
data.author: John R. Tunis

data.quote: Men who have attained things worth having in this world have worked while others idled  have persevered when others gave up in despair  have practiced early in life the valuable habits of self-denial  industry  and singleness of purpose. As a result  they enjoy in later life the success so often erroneously attributed to good luck.
data.author: Grenville Kleiser

data.quote: In the realm of ideas  everything depends on enthusiasm  in the real world  all rests on perseverance.
data.author: Johann von Goethe

data.quote: It takes time to be a success.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Actually  I'm an overnight success. But it took twenty years.
data.author: Monty Hall

data.quote: It takes time to succeed because success is merely the natural reward for taking time to do anything well.
data.author: Joseph Ross

data.quote: Success generally depends upon knowing how long it takes to succeed.
data.author: Charles de Montesquieu

data.quote: It takes twenty years to make an overnight success.
data.author: Eddie Cantor

data.quote: Success is to be measured not so much by the position that one has reached in life as by the obstacles which he has overcome.
data.author: Booker T. Washington

data.quote: Our business in life is not to get ahead of others but to get ahead of ourselves-to break our own records  to outstrip our yesterdays by our today  to do our work with more force than ever before.
data.author: Steward B. Johnson

data.quote: Success has always been easy to measure. It is the distance between one's origins and one's final achievement.
data.author: Michael Korda

data.quote: How can they say my life is not a success? Have I not for more than sixty years got enough to eat and escaped being eaten?
data.author: Logan Pearsall Smith

data.quote: Survival is triumph enough.
data.author: Harry Crews

data.quote: Success is peace of mind  which is a direct result of knowing you did your best to become the best that you are capable of becoming.
data.author: John Wooden

data.quote: Success is relative: It is what we can make of the mess we have made of things.
data.author: T. S. Eliot

data.quote: The conventional army loses if it does not win. The guerrilla wins if he does not lose.
data.author: Henry Kissinger

data.quote: The man who has done his level best  and who is conscious that he has done his best  is a success  even though the world may write him down a failure.
data.author: B. C. Forbes

data.quote: My success is measured by my willingness to keep trying.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: If you've had a good time playing the game  you're a winner even if you lose.
data.author: Malcolm Forbes

data.quote: Success is living up to your potential. That's all. Wake up with a smile and go after life.... Live it  enjoy it  taste it  smell it  feel it.
data.author: Joe Knapp

data.quote: I have fought a good fight  I have finished my course  I have kept the faith.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: On earth we have nothing to do with success or results  but only with being true to God  and for God. Defeat in doing right is nevertheless victory.
data.author: Frederick W. Robertson

data.quote: The reward of a thing well done is to have done it.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: I'd rather be a lamppost in Chicago than a millionaire in any other city.
data.author: William A. Hulbert

data.quote: A successful man is he who receives a great deal from his fellow men  usually incomparably more than corresponds to his service to them. The value of a man  however  should be seen in what he gives  and not in what he is able to receive.
data.author: Albert Einstein

data.quote: There is only one success-to be able to spend your life in your own way.
data.author: Christopher Morley

data.quote: We only do well the things we like doing.
data.author: Colette

data.quote: The only success worth one's powder was success in the line of one's idiosyncrasy ... what was talent but the art of being completely whatever one happened to be?
data.author: Henry James

data.quote: Success based on anything but internal fulfillment is bound to be empty.
data.author: Dr. Martha Friedman

data.quote: All I would tell people is to hold on to what was individual about themselves  not to allow their ambition for success to cause them to try to imitate the success of others. You've got to find it on your own terms.
data.author: Harrison Ford

data.quote: For me  writing is the only thing that passes the three tests of metier: (1) when I'm doing it  I don't feel that I should be doing something else instead  (2.) it produces a sense of accomplishment and  once in a while  pride  and (3) it's frightening.
data.author: Gloria Steinem

data.quote: My mother said to me  "If you become a soldier  you'll be a general  if you become a monk you'll end up as the pope." Instead  I became a painter and wound up as Picasso.
data.author: Pablo Picasso

data.quote: Abasement  degradation is simply the manner of life of the man who has refused to be what it is his duty to be.
data.author: Jose Ortega y Gasset

data.quote: Different people have different duties assigned to them by Nature  Nature has given one the power or the desire to do this  the other that. Each bird must sing with his own throat.
data.author: Henrik Ibsen

data.quote: A first rate soup is better than a second rate painting.
data.author: Abraham Maslow

data.quote: We can't all be heroes because someone has to sit on the curb and clap as they go by.
data.author: Will Rogers

data.quote: Nature magically suits a man to his fortunes  by making them the fruit of his character.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: I'd rather be a lamppost in Chicago than a millionaire in any other city.
data.author: William A. Hulbert

data.quote: We succeed in enterprises which demand the positive qualities we possess  but we excel in those which can also make use of our defects.
data.author: Alexis de Tocqueville

data.quote: A man can do only what he can do. But if he does that each day he can sleep at night and do it again the next day.
data.author: Albert Schweitzer

data.quote: Don't take anyone else's definition of success as your own. (This is easier said than done.)
data.author: Jacqueline Briskin

data.quote: Whatever you are by nature  keep to it  never desert your own line of talent. Be what nature intended you for  and you will succeed  be anything else and you will be ten thousand times worse than nothing.
data.author: Sydney Smith

data.quote: Ask yourself the secret of your success. Listen to your answer  and practice it.
data.author: Richard Bach

data.quote: I cannot do everything  but still I can do something  and because I cannot do everything I will not refuse to do something that I can do.
data.author: Edward Everett Hale

data.quote: Starting out to make money is the greatest mistake in life. Do what you feel you have a flair for doing  and if you are good enough at it  the money will come.
data.author: Greer Garson

data.quote: If a man has a talent and cannot use it  he has failed. If he has a talent and uses only half of it  he has partly failed. If he has a talent and learns somehow to use the whole of it  he has gloriously succeeded  and won a satisfaction and a triumph few men ever know.
data.author: Thomas Wolfe

data.quote: One can never consent to creep when one feels an impulse to soar.
data.author: Helen Keller

data.quote: Oh! Much may be done by defying The ghosts of Despair and Dismay And much may be gained by relying On "Where there's a Will There's a Way."
data.author: Eliza Cook

data.quote: We can never give up the belief that good guys always win. And that we are the good guys.
data.author: Faith Popcorn

data.quote: I know there will be spring  as surely as the birds know it when they see above the snow two tiny  quivering green leaves. Spring cannot fail us.
data.author: Olive Schreiner

data.quote: Most ball games are lost  not won.
data.author: Casey Stengel

data.quote: Never face facts  if you do you'll never get up in the morning.
data.author: Mario Thomas

data.quote: Before you can win a game  you have to not lose it.
data.author: Chuck Noll

data.quote: Football games aren't won  they're lost.
data.author: Fielding Yost

data.quote: Success is a journey  not a destination.
data.author: Ben Sweetland

data.quote: The journey is my home.
data.author: Muriel Rukeyser

data.quote: To travel hopefully is a better thing than to arrive  and the true success is to labor.
data.author: Robert Louis Stevenson

data.quote: The man who goes fishing gets something more than the fish he catches.
data.author: Mary Astor

data.quote: Despite the success cult  men are most deeply moved not by the reaching of the goal  but by the grandness of effort involved in getting there-or failing to get there.
data.author: Max Lerner

data.quote: To live only for some future goal is shallow. It's the sides of the mountain that sustain life  not the top.
data.author: Robert M. Pirsig

data.quote: The reward of the general is not a bigger tent  but command.
data.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

data.quote: It is good to have an end to journey toward  but it is the journey that matters  in the end.
data.author: Ursula K. LeGuin

data.quote: We're still not where we're going  but we're not where we were.
data.author: Natash Jasefowitz

data.quote: 'Tis the motive exalts the action  'Tis the doing  and not the deed.
data.author: Margaret Junkin Preston

data.quote: Arriving at one goal is the starting point to another.
data.author: John Dewey

data.quote: I think that wherever your journey takes you  there are new gods waiting there  with divine patience-and laughter.
data.author: Susan M. Watkins

data.quote: It has never been  and never will be  easy work! But the road that is built in hope is more pleasant to the traveler than the road built in despair  even though they both lead to the same destination.
data.author: Marion Zimmer Bradley

data.quote: In the long run  the pessimist may be proved to be right  but the optimist has a better time on the trip.
data.author: Daniel L. Reardon

data.quote: The excursion is the same when you go looking for your sorrow as when you go looking for your joy.
data.author: Eudora Welty

data.quote: The reward of a thing well done is to have done it.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: The struggle alone pleases us  not the victory.
data.author: Blaise Pascal

data.quote: The problem is not that you cannot have what you think you want. The problem is that when you get what you think you want  it won't satisfy.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: We should scarcely desire things ardently if we were perfectly acquainted with what we desire.
data.author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

data.quote: With the catching ends the pleasures of the chase.
data.author: Abraham Lincoln

data.quote: To have realized your dream makes you feel lost.
data.author: Oriana Fallaci

data.quote: Need and struggle are what excite and inspire us  our hour of triumph is what brings the void.
data.author: William James

data.quote: We spend our time searching for security  and hate it when we get it.
data.author: John Steinbeck

data.quote: Happiness is not a station to arrive at  but a manner of traveling.
data.author: Margaret Lee Runbeck

data.quote: Happiness is to be found along the way  not at the end of the road  for then the journey is over and it is too late.
data.author: Robert R. Updegraff

data.quote: The really happy man is one who can enjoy the scenery on a detour.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: You wear yourself out in the pursuit of wealth or love or freedom  you do everything to gain some right  and once it's gained you take no pleasure in it.
data.author: Oriana Fallaci

data.quote: Success is counted sweetest by those who ne'er succeed.
data.author: Emily Dickinson

data.quote: Granting our wish is one of Fate's saddest jokes.
data.author: James Russell Lowell

data.quote: Now that I'm here  where am I?
data.author: Janis Joplin

data.quote: Success is not greedy  as people think  but insignificant. That's why it satisfies nobody.
data.author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

data.quote: Is there anything in life so disenchanting as attainment?
data.author: Robert Louis Stevenson

data.quote: Nothing fails like success  nothing is so defeated as yesterday's triumphant cause.
data.author: Phyllis McGinley

data.quote: There are two tragedies in life. One is to lose your heart's desire. The other is to gain it.
data.author: George Bernard Shaw

data.quote: Success has ruined many a man.
data.author: Benjamin Franklin

data.quote: Fame always brings loneliness. Success is as ice cold and lonely as the North Pole.
data.author: Vicki Baum

data.quote: Success has killed more men than bullets.
data.author: Texas Guinan

data.quote: Achievement: The death of an endeavor  and the birth of disgust.
data.author: Ambrose Bierce

data.quote: Success and failure are equally disastrous.
data.author: Tennessee Williams

data.quote: The problems of victory are more agreeable than those of defeat  but they are no less difficult.
data.author: Winston Churchill

data.quote: We are never further from our wishes than when we imagine that we possess what we have desired.
data.author: Johann von Goethe

data.quote: Some aspects of success seem rather silly as death approaches.
data.author: Donald A. Miller

data.quote: Unless a man has been taught what to do with success after getting it  the achievement of it must inevitably leave him a prey to boredom.
data.author: Bertrand Russell

data.quote: If I had known what it would be like to have it all  I might have been willing to settle for less.
data.author: Lily Tomlin

data.quote: Success and failure are both difficult to endure. Along with success come drugs  divorce  fornication  bullying  travel  meditation  medication  depression  neurosis and suicide. With failure comes failure.
data.author: Joseph Heller

data.quote: The two hardest things to handle in life are failure and success.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: The best thing that can come with success is the knowledge that it is nothing to long for.
data.author: Liv Ullmann

data.quote: The closer one gets to the top  the more one finds there is no "top."
data.author: Nancy Barcus

data.quote: Oh  how quickly the world's glory passes away.
data.author: Thomas a Kempis

data.quote: The minute you think you've got it made  disaster is just around the corner.
data.author: Joe Paterno

data.quote: Creating success is tough. But keeping it is tougher. You have to keep producing  you can't ever stop.
data.author: Pete Rose

data.quote: Out of every fruition of success  no matter what  comes forth something to make a new effort necessary.
data.author: Walt Whitman

data.quote: The toughest thing about success is that you've got to keep on being a success. Talent is only a starting point in business. You've got to keep working that talent.
data.author: Irving Berlin

data.quote: We would often be sorry if our wishes were gratified.
data.author: Aesop

data.quote: Nothing except a battle lost can be half so melancholy as a battle won.
data.author: Arthur Wellesley

data.quote: Being frustrated is disagreeable  but the real disasters of life begin when you get what you want.
data.author: Irving Kristol

data.quote: We grow weary of those things (and perhaps soonest) which we most desire.
data.author: Samuel Butler

data.quote: Our desires always increase with our possessions. The knowledge that something remains yet unenjoyed impairs our enjoyment of the good before us.
data.author: Samuel Johnson

data.quote: Oddly enough  success over a period of time is more expensive than failure.
data.author: Grant Tinker

data.quote: There must be more to life than having everything!
data.author: Maurice Sendak

data.quote: It's not that I'm not grateful for all this attention. It's just that fame and fortune ought to add up to more than fame and fortune.
data.author: Robert Fulghum

data.quote: If you live long enough  you'll see that every victory turns into a defeat.
data.author: Simone de Beauvoir

data.quote: One more such victory and we are undone.
data.author: Pyrrhus

data.quote: Pray that success will not come any faster than you are able to endure it.
data.author: Elbert Hubbard

data.quote: The prospect of success in achieving our most cherished dream is not without its terrors. Who is more deprived and alone than the man who has achieved his dream?
data.author: Brendan Francis

data.quote: Success can also cause misery. The trick is not to be surprised when you discover it doesn't bring you all the happiness and answers you thought it would.
data.author: Prince

data.quote: Adversity is sometimes hard upon a man  but for one man who can stand prosperity  there are a hundred that will stand adversity.
data.author: Thomas Carlyle

data.quote: To me success means effectiveness in the world  that I am able to carry my ideas and values into the world-that I am able to change it in positive ways.
data.author: Maxine Hong Kingston

data.quote: If you have a good name  if you are right more often than you are wrong  if your children respect you  if your grandchildren are glad to see you  if your friends can count on you and you can count on them in time of trouble  if you can face your God and say "I have done my best " then you are a success.
data.author: Ann Landers

data.quote: Success is getting what you want  happiness is wanting what you get.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Life is a succession of moments. To live each one is to succeed.
data.author: Corita Kent

data.quote: I personally measure success in terms of the contributions an individual makes to his or her fellow human beings.
data.author: Margaret Mead

data.quote: He has achieved success  who has lived well  laughed often  and loved much  who has gained the respect of intelligent men and the love of little children.
data.author: Bessie A. Stanley

data.quote: Success has nothing to do with what you gain in life or accomplish for yourself. It's what you do for others.
data.author: Danny Thomas

data.quote: If you have a good name  if you are right more often than you are wrong  if your children respect you  if your grandchildren are glad to see you  if your friends can count on you and you can count on them in time of trouble  if you can face your God and say  "I have done my best " then you are a success.
data.author: Ann Landers

data.quote: Success is the sweetest revenge.
data.author: Vanessa Williams

data.quote: You have reached the pinnacle of success as soon as you become uninterested in money  compliments  or publicity.
data.author: Thomas Wolfe

data.quote: A woman who is loved always has success.
data.author: Vicki Baum

data.quote: Success is not a doorway  it's a staircase.
data.author: Dottie Walters

data.quote: There is no scientific answer for success. You can't define it. You've simply got to live it and do it.
data.author: Anita Roddick

data.quote: Marconi invented radio  but Ted Husing knew what to do with it.
data.author: Ralph Edwards

data.quote: The ultimate of being successful is the luxury of giving yourself the time to do what you want to do.
data.author: Leontyne Price

data.quote: I don't think success is harmful  as so many people say. Rather I believe it indispensible to talent: if for nothing else than to increase the talent.
data.author: Jeanne Moreau

data.quote: Success produces success  just as money produces money.
data.author: Nicolas de Chamfort

data.quote: If I do have some success  I'd like to enjoy it  for heaven's sake! What is the point of having it otherwise?
data.author: Leontyne Price

data.quote: God may allow His servant to succeed when He has disciplined him to a point where he does not need to succeed to be happy. The man who is elated by success and is cast down by failure is still a carnal man. At best his fruit will have a worm in it.
data.author: A. W. Tozer

data.quote: There is no business in the world so troublesome as the pursuit of fame: life is over before you have hardly begun your work.
data.author: Jean de la Bruyere

data.quote: Nothing fails like success because we don't learn from it. We learn only from failure.
data.author: Kenneth Boulding

data.quote: The insight to see possible new paths  the courage to try them  the judgment to measure results-these are the qualities of a leader.
data.author: Mary Parker Follett

data.quote: Success makes men rigid and they tend to exalt stability over all the other virtues  tired of the effort of willing  they become fanatics about conservatism.
data.author: Walter Lippman

data.quote: Success is a great healer.
data.author: Gertrude Atherton

data.quote: All outward success  when it has value  is but the inevitable result of an inward success of full living  full play and enjoyment of one's faculties.
data.author: Robert Henri

data.quote: There are three types of baseball players-those who make it happen  those who watch it happen  and those who wonder what happened.
data.author: Tommy Lasorda

data.quote: The exclusive worship of the bitch-goddess Success is our national disease.
data.author: William James

data.quote: Success causes us to be more praised than known.
data.author: Joseph Roux

data.quote: Along with success comes a reputation for wisdom.
data.author: Euripides

data.quote: Fame has only the span of the day  they say. But to live in the hearts of people-that is worth something.
data.author: Ouida

data.quote: Great men have not been concerned with fame. The joy of achievement that comes from finding something new in the universe is by far their greatest joy.
data.author: William P. King

data.quote: Out of the strain of the Doing  into the peace of the Done.
data.author: Julia Louise Woodruff

data.quote: Success is like a liberation  or the first phase of a love affair.
data.author: Jeanne Moreau

data.quote: There is always room at the top.
data.author: Daniel Webster

data.quote: An act of love that fails is just as much a part of the divine life as an act of love that succeeds  for love is measured by its own fullness  not by its reception.
data.author: Harold Loukes

data.quote: The best place to succeed is where you are with what you have.
data.author: Charles M. Schwab

data.quote: Success covers a multitude of blunders.
data.author: George Bernard Shaw

data.quote: How to succeed: try hard enough. How to fail: Try too hard.
data.author: Malcolm Forbes

data.quote: I have found that it is much easier to make a success in life than to make a success of one's life.
data.author: G. W. Follin

data.quote: There could be no honor in a sure success  but much might be wrested from a sure defeat.
data.author: T. E. Lawrence

data.quote: Bad will be the day for every man when he becomes absolutely contented with the life he is living  when there is not forever beating at the doors of his soul some great desire to do something larger.
data.author: Phillips Brooks

data.quote: When there is no feeling of accomplishment  children fail to develop properly and old people rapidly decline.
data.author: Joseph Whitney

data.quote: Those who have easy  cheerful attitudes tend to be happier than those with less pleasant temperaments  regardless of money  "making it " or success.
data.author: Dr. Joyce Brothers

data.quote: Theirs is not to reason why  theirs is but to do or die.
data.author: Alfred, Lord Tennyson

data.quote: Victory at all costs  victory in spite of all terror  victory however long and hard the hard may be  for without victory there is no survival.
data.author: Winston Churchill

data.quote: In war there is no second prize for the runner-up.
data.author: General Omar N. Bradley

data.quote: Success is simply a matter of luck. Ask any failure.
data.author: Earl Wilson

data.quote: Success didn't spoil me  I've always been insufferable.
data.author: Fran Lebowitz

data.quote: When asked how long I've worked here  I replied  "since the day they threatened to fire me."
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: He must really be a big success -  even his mother-in-law admits it.
data.author: Elmer Pasta

data.quote: The only time you find success before work is in the dictionary.
data.author: May V. Smith

data.quote: The haves and the have-nots can often be traced back to the dids and the did-nots.
data.author: D. O. Flynn

data.quote: Behind every successful man is a woman - with nothing to wear.
data.author: L. Grant Glickman

data.quote: She's the kind of woman who climbed the ladder of success  wrong by wrong.
data.author: Mae West

data.quote: If at first you succeed  don't take any more stupid chances.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: This guy put the suck in success.
data.author: David Letterman

data.quote: As soon as you find the key to success  somebody always changes the lock.
data.author: Tracey Ullman

data.quote: The penalty of success is to be bored by the people who used to snub you.
data.author: Lady Nancy Astor

data.quote: Certainly I believe in luck. How else do you explain the success of those you don't like?
data.author: Jean Cocteau

data.quote: Behold the turtle. He makes progress only when he sticks his neck out.
data.author: James Conant

data.quote: If at first you don't succeed  try  try  again. Then quit. There's no use being a damn fool about it.
data.author: W. C. Fields

data.quote: A leading authority is anyone who has guessed right more than once.
data.author: Frank A. Clark

data.quote: The nice thing about being a celebrity is that when you bore people  they think it's their fault.
data.author: Henry Kissinger

data.quote: My formula for success is rise early  work late  and strike oil.
data.author: J. Paul Getty

data.quote: Eagles may soar  but weasels don't get sucked into jet engines.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Sleep  riches  and health  to be truly enjoyed  must be interrupted.
data.author: Jean Paul Richter

data.quote: Sometimes "the fool who rushes in" gets the job done.
data.author: Al Bernstein

data.quote: I've always wanted to be somebody  but I see now I should have been more specific.
data.author: Lily Tomlin

data.quote: Ideas are like rabbits. You get a couple and learn how to handle them  and pretty soon you have a dozen.
data.author: John Steinbeck

data.quote: I'm a great believer in luck  and I find the harder I work the more I have of it.
data.author: Thomas Jefferson

data.quote: Luck is a matter of preparation meeting opportunity.
data.author: Oprah Winfrey

data.quote: There is some consolation in the fact that  even though your dreams don't come true  neither do your nightmares.
data.author: Richard Armour

data.quote: Success to me is having ten honeydew melons and eating only the top half of each one.
data.author: Barbra Streisand

data.quote: If your ship doesn't come in  swim out to it.
data.author: Jonathan Winters

data.quote: Progress means taking risks  for you can't steal home and keep your foot on third base.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: We can't all be heroes because someone has to sit on the curb and clap as they go by.
data.author: Will Rogers

data.quote: If you lose  you're going to be fired  and if you win  you only put off the day you're going to be fired.
data.author: Leo Durocher

data.quote: Success can make you go one of two ways. It can make you a prima donna  or it can smooth the edges  take away the insecurities  let the nice things come out.
data.author: Barbara Walters

data.quote: Successful minds work like a gimlet  - to a single point.
data.author: Christian Nestell Bovee

data.quote: All you need in this life is ignorance and confidence  and then Success is sure.
data.author: S. L. Clemens

data.quote: Success is counted sweetest By those who ne'er succeed.
data.author: Emily Dickinson

data.quote: Nothing succeeds like success.
data.author: Alexander Dumas

data.quote: There are but two ways of rising in the world: either by one's own industry or profiting by the foolishness of others.
data.author: Jean de la Bruyere

data.quote: I have always observed that to succeed in the world one should appear like a fool but be wise.
data.author: Charles Montesquieu

data.quote: Faith  mighty faith  the promise sees  And looks to that alone  Laughs at impossibilities  And cries it shall be done.
data.author: Charles Wesley

data.quote: Either do not attempt at all  or go through with it.
data.author: Ovid

data.quote: To climb steep hills Requires slow pace at first.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: Somebodys said that it couldn't be done  But he with a chuckle replied That "maybe it couldn't " but he would be one Who wouldn't say so till he'd tried. So he buckled right in with the trace of a grin On his face. If he worried he hid it. He started to sing as he tackled the thing That couldn't be done  and he did it.

data.quote: And he gave it for his opinion  that whoever could make two ears of corn  or two blades of grass  to grow upon a spot of ground where only one grew before  would deserve better of mankind and do more essential service to his country  than the whole race of politicians put together.

data.quote: I have trodden the winepress alone.

data.quote: As to Caesar  when he was called upon  he gave no testimony against Clodius  nor did he affirm that he was certain of any injury done to his bed. He only said  "He had divorced Pompeia because the wife of Caesar ought not only to be clear of such a crime  but of the very suspicion of it."

data.quote: Suspicion always haunts the guilty mind  The thief doth fear each bush an officer.

data.quote: The less we know the more we suspect.

data.quote: You think that upon the score of fore-knowledge and divining I am infinitely inferior to the swans. When they perceive approaching death they sing more merrily than before  because of the joy they have in going to the God they serve.

data.quote: If any pilgrim monk come from distant parts  with wish as a guest to dwell in the monastery  and will be content with the customs which he finds in the place  and does not perchance by his lavishness disturb the monastery  but is simply content with what he finds  he shall be received for as long as he desires. If  indeed  he find fault with anything  or expose it  reasonably  and with the humility of charity  the Abbott shall discuss it prudently lest perchance God had sent him for this very thing. But  if he have been found gossipy and contumacious in the time of his sojourn as guest  not only ought he not be joined to the body of the monastery  but also  it shall be said to him  honestly  that he must depart. If he does not go  let two stout monks  in the name of God  explain the matter to him.

data.quote: An ambassador is an honest man sent to lie abroad for the good of his country.

data.quote: Beware of him that telleth tales.

data.quote: Tush! These are trifles  and mere old wives' tales.

data.quote: What so tedious as a twice-told tale?

data.quote: I cannot tell how the truth may be  I say the tale as 'twas said to me.

data.quote: A tale never loses in the telling.

data.quote: But far more numerous was the herd of stfch  Who think too little  and who talk too much.

data.quote: When television is good  nothing is better. But when television is bad  nothing is worse. I invite you to sit down in front of your TV set and keep your eyes glued to that set until the station signs off. I can assure you that you will observe a vast wasteland.

data.quote: Television has proved that people will look at anything rather than each other.

data.quote: In the age of television  image becomes more important than substance.

data.quote: Television is the first truly democratic culture - the first culture available to everybody and entirely governed by what the people want. The most terrifying thing is what people do want.

data.quote: Television is not the truth. Television is a god-damned amusement park. Television is a circus  a carnival  a travelling troupe of acrobats  storytellers dancers  singers  jugglers  sideshow freaks  lion tamers and football players. We're in the boredom-killing business.

data.quote: I have a simple principle for the conduct of life - never to resist an adequate temptation.

data.quote: The only way to get rid of a temptation is to yield to it. Resist it  and your soul grows sick with longing for the things it has forbidden to itself.

data.quote: Never give in  never give in  never  never  never  never - in nothing great or small  large or petty - never give in except to convictions of honour and good sense.

data.quote: I generally avoid temptation unless I can't resist it.

data.quote: Blessed is the man that endureth temptation  for when he is tried  he shall receive the crown of life.

data.quote: Get thee behind me  Satan.

data.quote: I can resist everything except temptation.

data.quote: The feeling of inferiority rules the mental life and can be clearly recognized as the sense of incompleteness and unfulfillment  and in the uninterrupted struggle both of individuals and of humanity.
data.author: Alfred Adler

data.quote: Discipline does not mean suppression and control  nor is it adjustment to a pattern or ideology. It means a mind that sees 'what is' and learns from 'what was'.
data.author: Jiddu Krishnamurti

data.quote: That which enters the mind through reason can be corrected. That which is admitted through faith  hardly ever.
data.author: Santiago Ramon y Cajal

data.quote: Vanity plays lurid tricks with our memory.
data.author: Joseph Conrad

data.quote: Nostalgia is a seductive liar.
data.author: George W. Ball

data.quote: Was it always my nature to take a bad time and block out the good times  until any success became an accident and failure seemed the only truth?
data.author: Lillian Hellman

data.quote: Nostalgia: A device that removes the ruts and potholes from memory lane.
data.author: Doug Larson

data.quote: What was hard to bear is sweet to remember.
data.author: Portuguese proverb

data.quote: The heart's memory eliminates the bad and magnifies the good  and thanks to this artifice we manage to endure the burdens of the past.
data.author: Gabriel Garcia Marquez

data.quote: Some folks never exaggerate-they just remember big.
data.author: Audrey Snead

data.quote: A man's memory may almost become the art of continually varying and misrepresenting his past  according to his interest in the present.
data.author: George Santayana

data.quote: Praising what is lost makes the remembrance dear.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: God gave us memory that we might have roses in December.
data.author: Sir James M. Barrie

data.quote: There has never been an age that did not applaud the past and lament the present.
data.author: Lillian Eichler Watson

data.quote: Only sick music makes money today.
data.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

data.quote: Children today are tyrants. They contradict their parents  gobble their food  and tyrannize their teachers.
data.author: Socrates

data.quote: Posterity will say as usual: "In the past things were better  the present is worse than the past."
data.author: Anton Chekhov

data.quote: Our ignorance of history makes us libel to our own times. People have always been like this.
data.author: Gustave Flaubert

data.quote: Oh  this age! How tasteless and ill-bred it is!
data.author: Catullus

data.quote: This strange disease of modern life  with its sick hurry  its divided aims.
data.author: Matthew Arnold

data.quote: The illusion that times that were are better than those that are has probably pervaded all ages.
data.author: Horace Greeley

data.quote: Oh  what times! Oh  what standards!
data.author: Cicero

data.quote: Probably no one alive hasn't at one time or another brooded over the possibility of going back to an earlier  ideal age in his existence and living a different kind of life.
data.author: Hal Boyle

data.quote: The Golden Age was never the present Age.
data.author: Thomas Fuller

data.quote: The worst time is always the present.
data.author: Jean de la Fontaine

data.quote: The "good old times"-all times  when old  are good.
data.author: Lord Byron

data.quote: "The good old days." The only good days are ahead.
data.author: Alice Childress

data.quote: There are two kinds of stones  as everyone knows  one which rolls.
data.author: Amelia Earhart

data.quote: Recognizing what we have done in the past is a recognition of ourselves. By conducting a dialogue with our past  we are searching how to go forward.
data.author: Kiyoko Takeda

data.quote: I know of no way of judging the future but by the past.
data.author: Patrick Henry

data.quote: Those who cannot remember the past are condemned to repeat it.
data.author: George Santayana

data.quote: To look backward for a while is to refresh the eye  to restore it  and to render it more fit for its prime function of looking forward.
data.author: Margaret Fairless Barber

data.quote: The past is never dead-it is not even past.
data.author: William Faulkner

data.quote: The past is the best way to suppose what may come.
data.author: Lord Halifax

data.quote: We can never go back again  that much is certain. The past is still too close to us. The things we have tried to forget and put behind us would stir again  and that sense of fear  of furtive unrest... might in some manner unforeseen become a living companion  as it had before.
data.author: Daphne du Maurier

data.quote: Past: Our cradle  not our prison  and there is danger as well as appeal in its glamour. The past is for inspiration  not imitation  for continuation  not repetition.
data.author: Israel Zangwill

data.quote: Life can only be understood backwards  but it must be lived forward.
data.author: Soren Kierkegaard

data.quote: When I want to understand what is happening today or try to decide what will happen tomorrow  I look back.
data.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

data.quote: We live in the present  we dream of the future  but we learn eternal truths from the past.
data.author: Madame Chiang Kai-Shek

data.quote: The past is the best prophet of the future.
data.author: Lord Byron

data.quote: Truth  however bitter  can be accepted  and woven into a design for living.
data.author: Agatha Christie

data.quote: The past will not tell us what we ought to do  but... what we ought to avoid.
data.author: Jose Ortega y Gasset

data.quote: Tomorrow hopes we have learned something from yesterday.
data.author: John Wayne

data.quote: Judgement comes from experience  and great judgement comes from bad experience.
data.author: Robert Packwood

data.quote: The only use of a knowledge of the past is to equip us for the present.
data.author: Alfred North Whitehead

data.quote: When the past has taught us that we have more within us than we have ever used  our prayer is a cry to the divine to come to us and fill us with its power.
data.author: Rudolph Steiner

data.quote: Don't ruin the present with the ruined past.
data.author: Ellen Gilchrist

data.quote: Ah tell me not that memory Sheds gladness o'er the past  What is recalled by faded flowers Save that they did not last?
data.author: Letitia Landon

data.quote: Here lies my past  Goodbye I have kissed it  Thank you kids  I wouldn't have missed it.
data.author: Ogden Nash

data.quote: Forget the past and live the present hour.
data.author: Sarah Knowles Bolton

data.quote: Living in the past is a dull and lonely business  looking back strains the neck muscles  causes you to bump into people not going your way.
data.author: Edna Ferber

data.quote: I demolish my bridges behind me ... then there is no choice but forward.
data.author: Firdtjof Nansen

data.quote: Looking repeatedly into the past  you do not necessarily become fascinated with your own life  but rather with the phenomenon of memory.
data.author: Patricia Hampl

data.quote: Let the past drift away with the water.
data.author: Japanese saying

data.quote: The past cannot be changed. The future is yet in your power.
data.author: Mary Pickford

data.quote: I have very strong feelings about how you lead your life. You always look ahead  you never look back.
data.author: Ann Richards

data.quote: Not the power to remember  but its very opposite  the power to forget  is a necessary condition for our existence.
data.author: Sholem Asch

data.quote: You cannot step twice into the same river  for other waters are continually flowing on.
data.author: Heraclitus

data.quote: Better by far you should forget and smile  than that you should remember and be sad.
data.author: Christina Rossetti

data.quote: The past should be culled like a box of fresh strawberries  rinsed of debris  sweetened judiciously and served in small portions  not very often.
data.author: Laura Palmer

data.quote: May I forget what ought to be forgotten  and recall  unfailing  all that ought to be recalled  each kindly thing  forgetting what might sting.
data.author: Maty Caroline Davies

data.quote: Here's to the past. Thank God it's past!
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: One must be thrust out of a finished cycle in life  and that leap is the most difficult to make-to part with one's faith  one's love  when one would prefer to renew the faith and recreate the passion.
data.author: Anais Nin

data.quote: The biggest thing in today's sorrow is the memory of yesterday's joy.
data.author: Kahlil Gibran

data.quote: It's but little good you'll go a-water-ing the last year's crop.
data.author: George Eliot

data.quote: The worst thing you can do is to try to cling to something that's gone  or to recreate it.
data.author: Johnette Napolitano

data.quote: Ne'er look for the birds of this year in the nests of the last.
data.author: Miguel de Cervantes

data.quote: Don't look back. Something may be gaining on you.
data.author: Satchel Paige

data.quote: Anyone who limits her vision to memories of yesterday is already dead.
data.author: Lillie Langtry

data.quote: I like the dreams for the future better than the history of the past.
data.author: Thomas Jefferson

data.quote: The first recipe for happiness is: Avoid too lengthy meditations on the past.
data.author: Andre Maurois

data.quote: The past is a funeral gone by.
data.author: Edmund Gosse

data.quote: Never let yesterday use up today.
data.author: Richard H. Nelson

data.quote: How the past perishes is how the future becomes.
data.author: Alfred North Whitehead

data.quote: The dogmas of the quiet past are inadequate to the stormy present.
data.author: Abraham Lincoln

data.quote: In the life of the spirit there is no ending that is not a beginning.
data.author: Henrietta Zolde

data.quote: The past is but the beginning of a beginning  and all that is and has been is but the twilight of the dawn.
data.author: H. G. Wells

data.quote: Anyone who limits her vision to memories of yesterday is already dead.
data.author: Lillie Langtry

data.quote: Nor deem the irrevocable Past As wholly wasted  wholly vain  If  rising on its wrecks  at last To something nobler we attain.
data.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

data.quote: Youth is  after all  just a moment  but it is the moment  the spark that you always carry in your heart.
data.author: Raisa M. Gorbachev

data.quote: Nothing is predestined: The obstacles of your past can become the gateways that lead to new beginnings.
data.author: Ralph Blum

data.quote: No star is ever lost we once have seen  We always may be what we might have been.
data.author: Adelaide Proctor

data.quote: What's past is prologue.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: In my end is my beginning.
data.author: Mary Stuart

data.quote: The good old days were never that good  believe me. The good new days are today  and better days are coming tomorrow. Our greatest songs are still unsung.
data.author: Hubert H. Humphrey

data.quote: The past is never completely lost  khowever extensive the devastation. Your sorrows are the bricks and mortar of a magnificent temple. What you are today and what you will be tomorrow are because of what you have been.
data.author: Gordon Wright

data.quote: Fear not for the future  weep not for the past.
data.author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

data.quote: There are two days about which nobody should ever worry  and these are yesterday and tomorrow.
data.author: Robert Jones Burdette

data.quote: We crucify ourselves between two thieves: regret for yesterday and fear of tomorrow.
data.author: Fulton Oursler

data.quote: Every saint has a past  and every sinner has a future.
data.author: Oscar Wilde

data.quote: When I am anxious it is because I am living in the future. When I am depressed it is because I am living in the past.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: I'm not convinced that the world is in any worse shape than it ever was. It's just that in this age of almost instantaneous communication  we bear the weight of problems our forefathers only read about after they were solved.
data.author: Burton Hillis

data.quote: Truth has no beginning.
data.author: Mary Baker Eddy

data.quote: The world's history is constant  like the laws of nature  and simple  like the souls of men.
data.author: J. C. F. von Schiller

data.quote: These are the stories that never  never die  that are carried like seed into a new country  are told to you and me and make in us new and lasting strengths.
data.author: Meridel Le Sueur

data.quote: What one loves in childhood stays in the heart forever.
data.author: Mary Jo Putney

data.quote: This time  like all times  is a very good one if we but know what to do with it.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: In times like these  it helps to recall that there have always been times like these.
data.author: Paul Harvey

data.quote: Our ignorance of history makes us libel our own times. People have always been like this.
data.author: Gustave Flaubert

data.quote: The good old days are neither better nor worse than the ones we're living through right now.
data.author: Artie Shaw

data.quote: Where I was born and where and how I have lived is unimportant. It is what I have done with where I have been that should be of interest.
data.author: Georgia O'Keeffe

data.quote: Respect the past in the full measure of its deserts  but do not make the mistake of confusing it with the present  nor seek in it the ideals of the future.
data.author: Jose Ingenieros

data.quote: It's a pleasure to share one's memories. Everything remembered is dear  endearing  touching  precious. At least the past is safe-though we didn't know it at the time. We know it now. Because it's in the past  because we have survived.
data.author: Susan Sontag

data.quote: The events in our lives happen in a sequence in time  but in their significance to ourselves  they find their own order ... the continuous thread of revelation.
data.author: Eudora Welty

data.quote: The best compliment we can pay our past is to prophetically and bravely face today and tomorrow.
data.author: Bernie Wiebe

data.quote: Some memories are realities  and are better than anything that can ever happen to one again.
data.author: Willa Cather

data.quote: Fortunate are the people whose roots are deep.
data.author: Agnes Meyer

data.quote: As the dew to the blossom  the bud to the bee  As the scent to the rose  are those memories to me.
data.author: Amelia C. Welby

data.quote: Heirlooms we don't have in our family. But stories we've got.
data.author: Rose Chernin

data.quote: We have to do with the past only as we can make it useful to the present and the future.
data.author: Frederick Douglass

data.quote: The past is a guidepost  not a hitching post.
data.author: L. Thomas Holdcroft

data.quote: The past in retrospect holds manifold disenchantments  failures and even tragedies  and yet the worse may be forgotten and the best held fast.
data.author: W. Robertson Neicoll

data.quote: The road was new to me  as roads always are  going back.
data.author: Sarah Orne Jewett

data.quote: No yesterdays are ever wasted for those who give themselves to today.
data.author: Brendan Francis

data.quote: Yesterday I lived  today I suffer  tomorrow I die  but I still think fondly  today and tomorrow  of yesterday.
data.author: Gotthold Ephraim Lessing

data.quote: Each has his past shut in him like the leaves of a book shown to him by heart  and his friends can only read the title.
data.author: Virginia Woolf

data.quote: We are well advised to keep on nodding terms with the people we used to be  whether we find them attractive company or not.... We forget all too soon the things we thought we could never forget.
data.author: Joan Didion

data.quote: The past is a work of art  free of irrelevancies and loose ends.
data.author: Max Beerbohm

data.quote: The past is a foreign country  they do things differently there.
data.author: Leslie Poles Hartley

data.quote: The past with its pleasures  its rewards  its foolishness  its punishments  is there for each of us forever  and it should be.
data.author: Lillian Hellman

data.quote: The past is that which we possess fully and in whole.
data.author: Isidor Eliashev

data.quote: Our deeds still travel with us from afar  and what we have been makes us what we are.
data.author: George Eliot

data.quote: The past is the tomorrow that got away.
data.author: Leonard L. Levinson

data.quote: Our life is like some vast lake that is slowly filling with the stream of our years. As the waters creep surely upward the landmarks of the past are one by one submerged. But there shall always be memory to lift its head above the tide until the lake is overflowing.
data.author: Alexandre Charles Auguste Bisson

data.quote: Why should we grope among the dry bones of the past  or put the living generation into masquerade out of its faded wardrobe?
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: No past is dead for us  but only sleeping  love.
data.author: Helen Hunt Jackson

data.quote: I look back on my life like a good day's work  it is done and I am satisfied with it.
data.author: Grandma Moses

data.quote: Of all sad words of tongue or pen  the saddest are these: It might have been.
data.author: John Greenleaf Whittier

data.quote: That sign of old age  extolling the past at the expense of the present.
data.author: Sydney Smith

data.quote: The past is one evil less and one memory more.
data.author: Elbert Hubbard

data.quote: Then is then. Now is now. We must grow to learn the difference.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: The past not merely is not fugitive  it remains present.
data.author: Marcel Proust
